pros: Great people, great staff, everyone cares.
cons: there are no cons, for this location

job_title: Sterile Processing Technician in Argyle, TX
pros: Decent starting pay compared to other places I've worked at although it could be better for those with more experience When the pandemic hit, the company really took care of us even. Lots of free food I guess. The cafe was probably one of the best hospital foods I've had Diverse group of people hired.
cons: Management was an absolute nightmare. The team lead was always nitpicking every little thing while barely doing any work herself. I literally saw her stare at her phone instead of wrapping a battery for 20 min while I was in decon actually working and she didn't actually work unless somebody walked in on her. There were favorites and so much trash talking about other facilities that weren't as new. Employees with children were prioritized over those who didn't and their time was respected more as a result. Efficient work was punished with more work. So work slow and steady. Just be sure to look busy like the boss pretends to do. Complaints about harassment from other employees or management are not taken seriously unless you are in a position of power.

pros: Great coworkers and decent benefits
cons: Pay isn’t the highest around

job_title: Customer Service Team Lead in Decatur, TX
pros: I valued my team and my boss specifically in the customer service department. We truly were working toward making Wise Health System better. As the only team that sees patients accounts at the very end of their medical and billing cycle, we had the unique ability to find issues and correct them.
cons: The inability to evolve and change. We would continuously bring up issues and ways to help fix them, but they always fell on deaf ears. There is so much potential in this health system to not only increase profit, but also create a better patient experience, but no one is willing to change how things have always been done.

cons: The revenue cycle as a whole at WHS is broken. They do not evolve, and issues go ignored. As customer service, we had the unique ability of being able to see every issue that occurred on the account as we are the last stage of the billing cycle. Unfortunately, when we brought up issues to other teams they became defensive and were unwilling to change.

review_title: Wise Health System from the inside
pros: Very involved in their community.  Jason Wren, not Steve Summers, is the CEO now.  He is young, smart, and has an excellent vision for the company when compared to the previous CEO.  HIS hires are very strong professionally.
cons: Very little accountability among director-level leadership.  Lots of good-ol-boy back slapping and favoritism.  This system has 2000 employees but many still operate with a single-story, community hospital mindset.  Lots of nepotism here.  The desire to be better than the rest is missing.  Would do well to recruit new directors for patient care areas and directors that are at minimum, masters prepared and with outside experience other than just at WHS.

review_title: Love the Argyle location, bright, clean, fun and feels like you are on an A team.
pros:
At the Argyle location the management team all seem to have their heart in the right place. They know how to take care of the customer and their employees. 
Almost everyone of the patients who come in feel that vibe and enjoy their visit even it is having surgery. 

The facility is small, clean and bright. This a helps make it feel like a very personalized and good experience.

The staff is friendly to each other and the patients and family members.

You can almost always hear laughter in the cafe at lunch.
cons:
The great managment style and culture that you find at the Argyle location is not intrinsic throughout other locations especially at the main offices in Decatur where the decisions are made for nonclinical staff. 
So if you are looking for career growth then you would likely be faced with the decision to have to shift cultures as Decatur is where most of the next steps would take place.

From what I have seen at the next levels in nonclinical, people are over tasked and get burned out. Work life balance does not seem to be a big concern at the upper management in Decatur.

I've heard of many people having to take on more and more and never getting any compensation for the added responsibilities.


If you are a clinical staff in Argyle there is plenty of opportunity to grow and stay at Argyle.

I would give 5 stars for the Argyle location but 2 to 3 stars for the other Wise locations.

review_title: Large employer thats lost touch with employees
pros:
Decent health benefits
PTO accrual
cons:
HUGE disconnect between administration and program directors. They do not seem to care about improving current programs or implementing new ones that have patient care as the center focus. 
All they seem to care about is the optics in how they present themselves to the community, not about actual patient care.

review_title: Horrible training during short employment time. Negative trainers.

cons: Management has not a clue what they are doing. Training is limited, while expecting the employees to train themselves. Management feels that because they THINK that the trainer may be good doesn't mean it's true.
